text: a ceasefire in Syria's Idlib province
has just come into effect after months
of heavy bombardment by Syrian
government forces and their Russian
allies the truce was agreed by the
presidents of Turkey and Russia Alip is
the last region still controlled by the
jihadists and rebels who are backed by
turkey who have been trying to overthrow
the Syrian President Bashar al-assad
since 2011 the UN estimates almost a
million people have fled their home
since December because of the fighting
in the early hours of this morning
Russian airstrikes killed 16 civilians
sheltering in a farm in Marit MS Hren
our international correspondent or a
garam was there her report filmed by

here inexplicably a poultry farm which

hours before ceasefire talks began in

here win that Russian air but boom this
is from the bomb yes
civilians civilians we're all civilians
and they were killed as they slept
though the Syrian regime and its Russian

belongings you can see that this was a

lotions we've been hearing bombings in

nobody might have a Harley Ahmed tells

I don't know he says wondering if

like all medical facilities in here we

have been displaced by the fighting in
Syria and it has been putting further
pressure on Turkey which already has
almost four million Syrian refugees
Turkey opened its border to Greece last
week accusing the European Union of
inaction on refugees since then
thousands of migrants have been trying
to cross into the EU as our middle east
editor Jeremy Bowen reports
Syrian refugees have learned to be
skeptical about ceasefires in western
Turkey thousands who escaped the battles
before Eid Lib and other Middle Eastern
Wars followed a fence up to the Greek
border they went because Turkey's
president Erdogan finally came through
with his threat to pressurize the EU by
creating a new refugee crisis Greece
kept its gates closed for a generation
that grew up with death with war
stealing their chances of education it
was yet another blow my future has gone
that's why I think more about the future
of my children I want to have a house
for them give them a good life where
they don't need to rely on me or anybody
else to support them this family with
six children had made it to Greece where
they said the police stole all their
money and burnt their ID papers before
they were sent back trying to salvage
some dignity there are women here and we
don't have toilets what should they do
we have girls 10 and 11 years old they
can't go in the open in front of people
if you look at all the leaders in the
countries who've interfered and been
involved in the war in Syria can you
look at somebody anything yeah they're
to blame it's their fault the main
person responsible for us as Syrians is
Bashar al-assad as a president it's a
pity that you kill a child or harm a
human being just to stay in power
these people are pawns in a much bigger
game its roots lie in the catastrophic
international failure to stop the war in
Syria and the players in the game are
the big military powers who've
intervened in the Syrian war in their
own interests with little or no regard
for the safety of millions of people a
local Turkish man gave out food let
Europe see this he said I hope you're
ashamed it was cold
he made a fire of plastic rubbish to

most of them slept out in the open three
